Two careless students reused a prime in their RSA keys. Intercept their messages and recover the flag from this ciphertext: ciphertext1: 7609633571179251977525362914805773591375885158283347853111386291522209562361160730764899731758943940994073318310362531951096675479183374423736986484112909, ciphertext2: 3437151973127198172332967931968024589643204190601130688087343189347280542594940317749368014792475148627272428880772991522575820669717505407027973968034647

The flag format is flag{...}
n1=9060013532381011702325026852001625648378386809602318737312348517408293977521379867484509071910594085803223748286655724366018696969174940587283944760026913, n2=8085741265988966505845732469193873496888958777110358362283514148633336143930233174387980854019466042393660322310231762139013902765660622888051447263814747, e=3284240950428456042860805997713082770058965875053013495777342809135776861035547807534121950361804705289664145659416749366674166866076811465776395787042799

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{n3fxwvr0}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: ciphertext1: 7609633571179251977525362914805773591375885158283347853111386291522209562361160730764899731758943940994073318310362531951096675479183374423736986484112909, ciphertext2: 3437151973127198172332967931968024589643204190601130688087343189347280542594940317749368014792475148627272428880772991522575820669717505407027973968034647
vulnerability: common factors
hint: When two RSA moduli share a common factor, computing GCD(n1, n2) can reveal the shared prime factor.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n1=9060013532381011702325026852001625648378386809602318737312348517408293977521379867484509071910594085803223748286655724366018696969174940587283944760026913, n2=8085741265988966505845732469193873496888958777110358362283514148633336143930233174387980854019466042393660322310231762139013902765660622888051447263814747, e=3284240950428456042860805997713082770058965875053013495777342809135776861035547807534121950361804705289664145659416749366674166866076811465776395787042799
